summary: 90% of the nuclear waste in tanks at the Department of Energy's site in Hanford, WA is low-activity waste—it is much less radioactive than high-level waste. To solidify low-activity waste for safe disposal, it can be mixed with molten glass (used for high-level waste; costs more) or grout (costs less). title: Nuclear Waste: Opportunities Exist to Reduce Risks and Costs by Evaluating Different Waste Treatment Approaches at Hanford
